EmployeeLogin.retirementQuestionsTitle: Tell Us About Your Retirement Plans

retirementAge.question: At what age do you expect to begin withdrawing from your 401(k)?

incomeSecurity.question: How secure and predictable is your household income today?

options.veryUnpredictable: Very unpredictable — may vary a lot year to year
options.verySecure: Very secure — fixed or guaranteed income sources

investmentFamiliarity.question: How familiar are you with investing concepts (e.g., stocks, bonds, diversification)?

options.noExperience: No experience — this is new to me
options.advanced: Advanced — I understand complex details and strategies

marketReaction.question: If your 401(k) dropped 20% in one year, how would you most likely react?

options.sellEverything: Sell everything to avoid further losses
options.reduceInvestments: Reduce investments and move to safer options
options.stayInvested: Stay invested and wait for markets to recover
options.investMore: Invest more to take advantage of lower prices

riskTolerance.question: Thinking about past financial decisions, how much risk have you typically taken with your investments?

options.avoidedRisk: I have avoided risk almost completely
options.smallRisks: I have taken small, cautious risks
options.moderateRisks: I have taken moderate risks when appropriate
options.aggressiveRisks: I have taken aggressive risks in pursuit of higher returns

returnExpectation.question: Over the long term, what annual return range do you expect from your investments, knowing higher returns come with higher risk?

retirementConfidence.question: How confident are you that your current savings rate and assets will be enough for retirement?

options.notConfident: Not confident — I will need significant growth or extra savings
options.somewhatConfident: Somewhat confident — I will need above-average returns
options.confident: Confident — I should reach my goals with moderate growth
options.veryConfident: Very confident — I could meet my goals even with conservative growth

Pricing.note: NOTE: If your company is setting up a 401(k) plan for the first time, it is entitled to get back up to $x of plan costs as tax credits regardless of the plan option selected. Moreover, Employer contributions to a 401(k) plan are tax-deductible for the company.

faq.answer: The earliest start date is based on your onboarding timeline and payroll schedule. If you need an earlier date, please contact support.

description.part1: The Custodian will operate as the Plan Trustee for GlidingPath plans unless specified otherwise.
description.part2: is the individual responsible for overseeing the 401(k) plan's assets. This is typically a fiduciary owner, CEO or other fiduciary authorized to manage the plan's financial responsibilities. The Trustee is a U.S. person with either a SSN or ITIN.

starter.title: Design the Starter 401(k) plan
starter.description: Configure your plan to meet your company's needs and compliance requirements.

employeeEligibility.title: Employee eligibility
employeeEligibility.description: Employees who meet the following criteria will be invited to enroll in this plan.

autoEnrolled.title: Auto-enrolled employees
autoEnrolled.description: The IRS requires employees to be automatically enrolled at the following employee contribution rate unless they choose their own rate or opt out.
autoEnrolled.info: If the rate is below 10%, the IRS requires yearly increases until it reaches that threshold. You can set the rate to 10% or higher to avoid the escalation.

traditional.title: Design the Traditional 401(k) plan
traditional.description: Configure your plan to meet your company's needs and compliance requirements.

employerContribution.title: Set up Employer contribution
employerContribution.subtitle: Select an employer contribution to support employee retirement savings.
employerContribution.description: Determine how much to contribute to your employee's retirement
employerContribution.contributionType: What type of employer contribution will you provide?
employerContribution.percentageQuestion: What percentage of an employee's pay will you contribute?
employerContribution.vestingQuestion: When will your employees own the contributions? (i.e., Vesting Schedule)

employeeEligibility.title: Employee eligibility
employeeEligibility.description: Employees who meet the following criteria will be invited to enroll in this plan.

autoEnrolled.title: Auto-enrolled employees
autoEnrolled.description: The IRS requires employees to be automatically enrolled at the following employee contribution rate unless they choose their own rate or opt out.
autoEnrolled.defaultRateNote: The minimum contribution rate needed to receive the full employer match is 5%.
autoEnrolled.annualIncreaseRate: How much will the contribution rate increase by annually?
autoEnrolled.maximumContributionRate: What is the maximum contribution rate?
autoEnrolled.infoBox: The IRS requires annual increases for auto-enrolled employees with a default contribution rate below 10%, to help boost their savings.

profitSharing.title: Profit sharing feature
profitSharing.description: Add Profit Sharing to your 401(k) plan and decide how much to contribute each year — discretionary, flexible, and tax-deductible.
profitSharing.proRataNote: If you choose to offer profit sharing the vesting schedule determines when the employee will own the contributions.

main.title: Set a Safe Harbor employer contribution

basic.label: 4% basic match
basic.description: You'll match 100% of the first 3% of employee pay, then 50% of the next 2%.

custom.label: Custom match
custom.description: Choose to match between 3.5% - 6% of an employee's pay, and set when they will own the contributions.

nonelective.label: Nonelective contribution
nonelective.description: Choose a minimum of 3% to contribute to any eligible employee's 401(k) plan regardless of whether they contribute or not.

summary.title: Design the Safe Harbor 401(k) plan
summary.description: Configure your plan to meet your company's needs and compliance requirements.

employerContribution.title: Set up Employer Safe Harbor contribution
employerContribution.subtitle: Select a Safe Harbor contribution to ensure compliance and support employee retirement savings.
employerContribution.description: Determine how much to contribute to your employee's retirement
employerContribution.contributionType: What type of employer contribution will you provide?
employerContribution.percentageQuestion: What percentage of an employee's pay will you contribute?
employerContribution.vestingQuestion: When will your employees own the contributions?
employerContribution.infoBox: You'll match 100% on the first 3% of employee pay, then you'll match 50% on the next 2%. Employees own the contributions as soon as they're made.
employerContribution.safeHarborNote: For a Safe Harbor plan the employer contribution is immediate vesting.

employeeEligibility.title: Employee eligibility
employeeEligibility.description: Employees who meet the following criteria will be invited to enroll in this plan.

autoEnrolled.title: Auto-enrolled employees
autoEnrolled.description: The IRS requires employees to be **automatically enrolled** with a default employee contribution rate unless they choose their own rate or opt out.
autoEnrolled.defaultRateNote: The minimum contribution rate needed to receive the full employer match is 5%.
autoEnrolled.annualIncreaseRate: how much will the contribution rate increase by annually ?
autoEnrolled.maximumContributionRate: What is the maximum contribution rate?
autoEnrolled.infoBox: The IRS requires annual increases for auto-enrolled employees with a default contribution rate below 10%, to help boost their savings.

employerContribution.mainQuestion: Do you want to offer an employer match?

matchSection.title: Match

maxSection.title: Up to a maximum

vestingSection.title: Vesting Schedule
vestingSection.description: When will your employees own the contributions?

employerContribution.summary: You'll match {{match}} of an employee's contributions, up to {{max}} of their pay. Employees own the contributions as soon as they're made.
employerContribution.safeHarborNote: By contributing 0.5% more, you can switch to a Safe Harbor 401(k), avoiding the annual nondiscrimination testing required by a traditional 401(k).

faq.question: What if I change my mind?
faq.answer: Adjusting future employer contribution is simple and can be done with 30 days advance notice. However, changing the vesting schedule is more complex. Generally, changes that benefit employees are easier to implement than those that don't. If you're unsure, starting with a longer vesting period is recommended to keep your options open.

contributionRate.title: What should the default employee contribution rate be?
contributionRate.description: Eligible employees will be automatically enrolled at the following employee contribution rate unless they choose their own rate or opt out.
contributionRate.info: If this rate is below 10%, the IRS requires annual increases until it reaches that threshold. You can set the rate to 10% or higher to remove the escalation.
contributionRate.minimumContribution: The minimum contribution rate needed to receive the full employer match is 3%.

annualIncrease.title: How much should auto-enrolled employee contributions increase by annually?
annualIncrease.description: The IRS requires an annual increase for auto-enrolled employees whose default contribution rate is under 10%, aiming to boost employee savings.
annualIncrease.annualIncreaseLabel: How much will the contribution rate increase by annually?
annualIncrease.maxContributionLabel: What is the maximum contribution rate?
annualIncrease.faqQuestion: What if I don't want to include an annual increase?
annualIncrease.faqAnswer: You can opt out of annual increases, but this may affect compliance with IRS requirements and could impact employee savings growth.

limitations.title: Understanding the limitations of a Starter 401(k) plan
limitations.description: A Starter 401(k) plan can be a great beginner plan for companies, however you should be aware of its limitations
limitations: Can't change to a standard 401(K) until Jan 1, 2026

nondiscrimination.title: Nondiscrimination testing acknowledgment
nondiscrimination.description: With a Traditional 401(k), you'll have to pass annual nondiscrimination tests. If your plan fails testing, corrections will be required, which may include:

corrections.0: Mandatory employer contributions to non-highly compensated or non-key employees, and/or
corrections.1: Refund of 401(k) contributions to highly compensated employees.

nondiscrimination.complianceNote: Glidingpath provides compliance monitoring to help identify potential issues and manage required corrections.

employerContribution.title: Employer Contribution
employerContribution.description: A Safe Harbor plan requires a 3% minimum contribution. To contribute less, switch to a Traditional 401(k). To contribute more or add a longer vesting schedule, contact us.

contributionPercentage.label: Contribution Percentage
contributionPercentage.tooltip: What percentage of pay will you contribute?

vestingSchedule.label: Vesting schedule
vestingSchedule.tooltip: When will employees own the contributions?

employerContribution.summary: You'll match 100% on the first 3% of employee pay, then you'll match 50% on the next 2%. Employees own the contributions as soon as they're made.

qaca.question: What is QACA and how do I set one up?
qaca.answer:
QACA (Qualified Automatic Contribution Arrangement) offers a lower employer match commitment compared to traditional safe harbor plans, making them a cost-effective option for employers. These plans also allow for a vesting schedule instead of immediate vesting, which can help with employee retention.

To set up a QACA, you'll need to choose:
• A vesting schedule (not immediate), OR
• A 3.5% employer match.

changeMind.question: What if I change my mind?
changeMind.answer: Adjusting future employer contribution is simple and can be done with 30 days advance notice. However, changing the vesting schedule is more complex. Generally, changes that benefit employees are easier to implement than those that don't. If you're unsure, starting with a longer vesting period is recommended to keep your options open. Learn more

minimumAge.title: Minimum age
minimumAge.description: Set the minimum age required for your employees to be eligible to participate.

faq.question: Are part-time employees or temp workers eligible?
faq.answer: Part-time and temp workers may be eligible depending on your plan's specific requirements and federal regulations. Check your plan details or consult your provider for more information.

timeEmployed.title: Time employed
timeEmployed.description: Set the minimum employment length required for employees to be eligible to participate. This is based on elapsed time (not hours of service).

newHires.title: New hires
newHires.description: Employees hired after the plan start date. This will be the default service requirement.

existingEmployees.title: Existing employees
existingEmployees.description: Employees working at the time of the plan start date.

timeEmployed.info:
Did you know
Over 50% of our plans allow their employees to participate immediately upon hire.

partTime.question: Are part-time employees or temp workers eligible?
partTime.answer: Part-time and temp workers may be eligible depending on your plan's specific requirements and federal regulations. Check your plan details or consult your provider for more information.

rehired.question: What about re-hired employees?
rehired.answer: Re-hired employees may be subject to different eligibility rules. Please review your plan document or consult your provider for details.

profitSharingFormula.helpText: Select the formula that best fits your business needs
profitSharingFormula.info: The formula you choose will determine how profit sharing contributions are distributed among eligible employees.

proRata.label: Pro-rata
proRata.description: Participants receive an amount equal to a specified percentage of their total compensation.

flatDollar.label: Flat dollar
flatDollar.description: Every employee receives the same amount, regardless of their total compensation.

newComparability.label: New comparability
newComparability.description: Choose a total amount and we distribute amongst employees to maximize amounts for owners (best for older owners with a younger work force).

vestingSchedule.title: Set a profit sharing vesting schedule
vestingSchedule.description: If you choose to offer profit sharing, this is when employees will gain ownership of the contributions (vesting).
vestingSchedule.label: What vesting schedule do you want?

faq.question: What if I change my mind?
faq.answer: Adjusting future vesting schedules may be possible, but can be complex. Generally, changes that benefit employees are easier to implement. If you're unsure, starting with a longer vesting period is recommended to keep your options open.
